intro: Streptocarpus peltatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces vibrant purple or blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Streptocarpus peltatus is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
